prototypes.prototype: C a5wcb_editJavascript(C JSCode [,C title [,C eventName [,C otherMode [,* ox [,C helpComment [,* lv ]]]]]]) '

argument.name: JSCode
argument.description: A string that contains the JavaScript code to show in the editor.

argument.name: title
argument.description: Default = "". The title of the Javascript Editor. The title is often the same as the *[xb:eventName]*.

argument.name: eventName
argument.description: Default = "". The name of the event.

argument.name: otherMode
argument.description: Default = "". The type of dialog display. Options include *[xb:"dialog2"]* -- this should be the value specified in most cases. Other valeus reserved for internal use only.

argument.name: ox
argument.description: Default = null_value(). An options object that defines what tools should be included in the Javascript editor.

argument.name: helpComment
argument.description: Default = "". An optional help comment to include in the Javascript Editor - shown at the top of the screen. If a help comment is specified, the user can choose to oppress the help comment by typing *[js://nosystemcomment]*.

page.description: Used in Component Builder to prompt for javascript code.

discussion.p: The *[xb:a5wcb_editJavascript()]* function is used in the Component Builder to provide a prompt for editing JavaScript code. It can be used when defining an add-in control to allow the user to define custom JavaScript to execute in Javascript events for the control.
